title: 820-2915-B - Green light no boot (no 5V)
message:
This board looked very clean. There was corrosion on J3500 pin 16 but no where else. I used the USC anyway but  I couldn't see any other issues. 

I'm not sure where to find the course of the PP5V_S0 but after looking and looking It seems to come from U9500.

There is no 5v coming from here.

No PP5V_S0 from u9500

Pin 19 VSS is 0v
Pin 3 VCC is 3.6v not 5v
Pin 5 Vref3 is 3.2v not 5v

How do I identify the switch to turn on pin 19?

Any other ideas as to what my issue might be? I have looked at many videos but they all seem to end in finding a corroded area and replacing the component. I don't have any obvious bad components.

Thank you

title: 820-2915-B - Green light no boot (no 5V)
message: U9500 has nothing to do with 5V. You are measuring 5V_S0 but is 5V_S3 even there. Are you using a known good REAL ORIGINAL 85W charger? PPBUS voltage?

title: 820-2915-B - Green light no boot (no 5V)
message:
Yes to the know good 85W OEM charger.

PPBUS_G3H at R5400 and R5410 is 12.59V
F7040 and F7041 12.59v

title: 820-2915-B - Green light no boot (no 5V)
message: I asked about 5V_S3 and is 3V3_S5 present. SMC_ADPATER_EN present?

title: 820-2915-B - Green light no boot (no 5V)
message:
5V_S3 at l3408 0v  R4532 0v  U4600 pin 5 0v
3V3_S5 C4605 0v  
C9841 pin 1  Fluctuates from 1.01-.0046
U9480 Pin 5 Fluctuates from 1.01-.0046

SMC_ADAPTER_EN  u4900 pin 64  3.3v   R5074 3.4v

title: 820-2915-B - Green light no boot (no 5V)
message: Is PPBUS even present?

title: 820-2915-B - Green light no boot (no 5V)
message: PPBUS_G3H at R5400 and R5410 is 12.59V

title: 820-2915-B - Green light no boot (no 5V)
message:
Interesting
R4260 and C4260 have 12.59v  so does Q4262 pin 4
4260 in 1,2,5,6  have .03v each. F4260  is also .034 both sides.

title: 820-2915-B - Green light no boot (no 5V)
message: Q4260 pin 4 is 12.57v  and pin 3 is 12.24v

title: 820-2915-B - Green light no boot (no 5V)
message: G2_EN present?

title: 820-2915-B - Green light no boot (no 5V)
message:
Checking it at u4500 pin 3 It reads .088 which I guess is nothing.
c4501 the same .087
u4350 the same .087
c4350 also only .087

title: 820-2915-B - Green light no boot (no 5V)
message:
So following G2_EN.
At R7940 the voltage fluctuates from 3.4v to .003v rapidly.

title: 820-2915-B - Green light no boot (no 5V)
message: If G2_EN is pulsing PP3V3_S5 should also be pulsing at the same rate. If not then something wrong around the TPS51980.

title: 820-2915-B - Green light no boot (no 5V)
message:
PP3V3_S5 is pulsing but much less voltage:
r7940 1.002v - .002v
R7812  .998v - .003v

BTW thank you for your help. I'm sure that much of this is a pain in the *ss for you but the assistance you offer is very much appreciated.

title: 820-2915-B - Green light no boot (no 5V)
message: S5_PWRGD pulsing too?

title: 820-2915-B - Green light no boot (no 5V)
message: Make sure there are no pulses at PP5V_S3. If there is 100% nothing there then check all rails for short. Is PPBUS stable at 12.6V?

title: 820-2915-B - Green light no boot (no 5V)
message:
PPBUS_G3H  "was" stable at 12.6v until I shorted r5301 pin 1 and R5312 pin 1,, now the 12.6v is dropping slowly... no green light any more... $##%!^&#@^....  

Previous to my shorting the to resistors.. I had 0v at  PP5V_S3.

title: 820-2915-B - Green light no boot (no 5V)
message:
I see no reason to even measure at those resistors.....
Probably killed the ISL or SMC now.

title: 820-2915-B - Green light no boot (no 5V)
message:
No doubt. I'll start over and see what I can find.
I did find a bad R7261 pin side was broken off. weird. I'm not sure if that was an original problem or the result of my shorting out the other resisters.

I measured at those resistors because they were ones that show up when searching for PPBUS_G3H.  How do I determine the best or most likey places to check buses

title: 820-2915-B - Green light no boot (no 5V)
message: Best to measure rails directly at the big coils.

title: 820-2915-B - Green light no boot (no 5V)
message:
No boot and no Green light.
One wire has 3.42v at u6900 pins 1,4 and 5
u6900 has 3.42v at pins 1,2,4 and 5.

3.42v at pin 14 u7000  so I have  SMC BC ACOK.

title: 820-2915-B - Green light no boot (no 5V)
message: To start your SMC and/or ISL6259 is bad at this point you killed that. I advice against putting effort in this board. It'll be back with a dead GPU in a few months anyway.

title: 820-2915-B - Green light no boot (no 5V)
message: I've been in denial thinking that the SMC was shot... *sigh*... on to the next one. Thank you for your help.
